newsitem.title: USA: US High Court refuses to stop NationsBank deal.
newsitem.headline: US High Court refuses to stop NationsBank deal.

text.p: U.S. Supreme Court Justice Stephen Breyer Monday refused to block NationsBank Corp's $9.8 billion acquisition of Boatmen's Bancshares Inc Inc.
A court spokeswoman said Breyer rejected a request from two community groups, which oppose the transaction, for an emergency stay order preventing the deal from going through.
On Friday, a U.S. Court of Appeals in Denver denied a stay sought by the two groups -- InnerCity Press/Community on the Move and the New Mexico Alliance -- to stop the acquisition.

The groups argued bank customers would be harmed by the merger of St. Louis-based Boatmen's with NationsBank, based in Charlotte, N.C. They said the acquisition will result in bank closings and higher ATM fees.
The transaction is expected to close on Tuesday.
